justification: “We defined exploratory behavior as switching responses and non-maximizing responses. A switching response was defined as choosing a different monster than the one chosen on the previous trial.”

The article states, “We defined exploratory behavior as switching responses and non-maximizing responses… A non-maximizing response was defined as choosing a monster other than the one offering the highest payoff observed thus far.”
Participants’ ability to detect the reward switch was assessed by the post-test question asking which monster gave out 8 stars; correct identification indicated successful change detection.
